newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - July 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Bangladesh Newspapers - July 7.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bangladesh press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
Security for President Shahabuddin Ahmed and Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina may be tighthened further, following recent recovery of a smuggled rocket launcher.
Opposition leader Begum Khaleda Zia on Sunday criticised a section of intellectuals for saying that Bangladesh did not require army.

Bangladesh parliament on Monday unanimously adopted a resolution condemning printing and publishing of "obscene and blasphemous posters" on the holy Quran and the prophet in the occupied territory of Palestine.
Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina returned home late on Sunday after a six-day official trip to Japan.
A contingent of 21 army personnel from Bosnia is due to arrive in Dhaka shortly to receive training from Bangladesh Military Academy.
Some 38 ships remained stranded in the jetty and outer anchorage of the Chittagong Port as the strike by dock workers continued for the fourth consecutive day on Sunday.
Export earnings from major items, including readymade garments, leather and frozen foods, fell short of their targets during the last fiscal year (July'96-June'97).
The imposition of import surcharge and VAT on computers at both retail and wholesale level would hit hard the growth of computer know-how, Bangladesh Computer Society said. REUTER
